abstract.p: Interpublic Group of Cos is combining three of four offices of its Ludgate Communications unit with offices of its Golin/Harris International unit; BSMG Worldwide acquires Scotchbrook Communications, which will be renamed Scotchbrook/BSMG Worldwide; acquires GJW and Lyons Waddell, which will be merged with BSMG's London operation; BSMG renames its Bozell Eskew unit Sawyer Miller & Co (M)

block.p: Public relations units of large agency companies are making changes.
The Interpublic Group of Companies is combining three of the four offices of Ludgate Communications with another public relations agency owned by Interpublic, Golin/Harris International in Chicago.
Public relations units of large agency companies are making changes.
The Interpublic Group of Companies is combining three of the four offices of Ludgate Communications with another public relations agency owned by Interpublic, Golin/Harris International in Chicago.

In Frankfurt, Germany, B&L Ludgate will become Golin/Harris B&L. In London, the Ludgate office becomes Golin/Harris Ludgate, in addition to the London office of Golin/ Harris. In New York, the Ludgate office will be absorbed into the New York office of Golin/Harris. The Hong Kong office of Ludgate remains in operation.
And BSMG Worldwide, a corporate communications agency that is part of True North Communications, has made three acquisitions.
BSMG acquired Scotchbrook Communications, a public relations agency in Hong Kong, Malaysia and Singapore, for undisclosed terms. Scotchbrook will be renamed Scotchbrook/BSMG Worldwide.

In addition, BSMG acquired two London agencies to be merged with the BSMG operation in London, for undisclosed terms. They are GJW, a public affairs agency, and Lyons Waddell, a consumer public relations shop.
Separately, Bozell Eskew in New York and Washington, the ad agency unit of BSMG Worldwide, was renamed Sawyer Miller & Company.
